content.raw: Also the “syntax error” seems to be code check saying that it doesn’t know how to parse the syntax; I don’t think it’s saying that there’s an actual error there \(… at least it shouldn’t be saying there’s an error, because there definitely isn’t an error\).  The codecheck target is still returning with success, regardless of that printout, so I recommend we just ignore it \(unless there’s a way to suppress this type of output\).
content.html: Also the “syntax error” seems to be code check saying that it doesn’t know how to parse the syntax; I don’t think it’s saying that there’s an actual error there (… at least it shouldn’t be saying there’s an error, because there definitely isn’t an error). The codecheck target is still returning with success, regardless of that printout, so I recommend we just ignore it (unless there’s a way to suppress this type of output).
